mxCell.value: Goals of Testing
Automate the process of ensuring that our app works as we expect
Keep us form having to manually click around the app to find bugs
Make sure the app still works as expected even after we change something
My Personal Thoughts
People spend more time setting up testing than they do writing tests
All testing frameworks/libraries are essentially the same
You don't even have to use a testing library
Write a tiny node project
Figure out how to test it without any outside testing library
Test it using a testing lib
Take a look a previous project we built in this course
Test it using a testing lib
Write our own testing framework that will work in about 80% of all projects
Types of Testing
End to End
Make sure one class or function works correctly
Make sure multiple parts of the app work together.
Test the full behavior of the app
Benchmark the performance of a feature and ensure it doesn't get worse over time
'Does the app even work?'
Common test runners.  They execute a series of tests and report some feedback
Must be a Node-based CLI framework
Testing Framework Requirements
Must be able to test browser-based JS apps (!!!!)
Must require very, very little setup
Must be able to test a whole application, not just one little widget
CLI must have a 'watch mode' so we don't have to keep restarting it over and over
CLI must automatically find and run all files in our project that have a name of '*.test.js'
File Collection
Test environment setup
Test file execution
Implementation Plan
Report results
Find all files ending in '*.test.js' recursively through a folder
Store a reference to each file we find
After getting a full list of the test files, execute them one by one
File Collection
Breadth First
Mocha in the Browser
Email Validation
We had a function to run as many times as we wanted
We could create a new autocomplete for each test
Direct handle onto the function we want to test
Form logic executes instantly with 'index.js' being loaded
No easy ability to bind to a second form
Effectively, can only run one test
Representation of the DOM
Thing we can poke and prod to make sure our app is working!
We tell JSDOM to load up index.html
JSDOM fetches the HTML file and parses it. 'fromFile' promise resolved!
Our tests run
We submit form, check h1
JSDOM loads up the index.js file and executes code in it
